key_changes: Added import statements for translation JSON files (en, he, es)
Replaced empty translation objects with imported translation data
Connected actual translation resources to i18next configuration
file_insights.reasoning: This file is the configuration hub for i18n; fixing it enables all translations to load properly

patterns_discovered.description: i18next requires actual translation objects to be imported and bound to language codes in the resources configuration
patterns_discovered.context: Without proper resource binding, i18next will have empty translation objects and display missing keys instead of translated text

patterns_discovered.description: Project uses three languages (English, Hebrew, Spanish) with separate JSON files per language
patterns_discovered.context: Centralized import strategy in config.ts allows clean separation of concerns and maintainability

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Empty Translation Objects Don't Fail Silently
gotchas_discovered.description: When translation resources are initialized as empty objects, i18next doesn't error but instead displays the translation keys themselves (e.g., 'greeting' instead of 'Hello')
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Always verify that imported translation files are properly bound to their language codes in resources configuration

gotchas_discovered.description: JSON imports in TypeScript/JavaScript must point to exact file paths including .json extension
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Ensure translation file paths in imports match exactly (./locales/en.json, ./locales/he.json, ./locales/es.json)

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully fixed i18n configuration by importing translation JSON files and binding them to the corresponding language resources
execution_steps: Identified that translation resources were initialized as empty objects
Created/verified translation JSON files exist in frontend/src/i18n/locales/
Added import statements for en.json, he.json, and es.json translation files
Replaced empty translation objects with the imported translation data
Verified English translations display correctly in the application

recommendations.details: Add a script or test to validate that all translation keys used in components exist in all language JSON files to prevent missing translations
Document the expected structure of translation JSON files (namespace structure, key naming conventions) for developers adding new translations

recommendations.recommendation: Consider Lazy Loading for Large Translation Files
recommendations.details: If translation files grow significantly, consider implementing language-specific code splitting or lazy loading to reduce initial bundle size
Configure i18next with a fallback language (e.g., English) to gracefully handle missing translation keys in other languages
